member.name: T:CM.Sms.MessageEncoding
member.summary:
A message with the GSM encoding can contain only characters in the gsm character set, 1 message can contain up to 160 characters.
An unicode message can contain only contain 80 characters, but can all unicode characters.
Use auto to select unicode automatically when non-gsm characters are in the message.

member.name: P:CM.Sms.MessageOptions.MaximumNumberOfParts
member.summary:
To send messages longer than 160 characters you need to send them as multipart message (also called concatenated messages). We will cut the message into more smaller messages and the phone will paste them together again.
Please note that there are a few limitations to using multipart messages:
Each message part can only contain up to 153 characters.
The SMS standard theoretically permits up to 255 message parts. In practice you should try to limit your message to 8 message parts
Another note is that not all operators in the world are able to handle multipart messages, so you will need to test for which operators it works.

member.name: M:CM.Sms.SmsGatewayClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Initializes a new SmsGatewayClient using the appSettings from the App.config or Web.config. The following settings are read:
<appSettings> <add key="cm.smsgateway.url" value="https://secure.cm.nl/smssgateway/cm/gateway.ashx"/> (optional) <add key="cm.smsgateway.producttoken" value="YOUR PRODUCT TOKEN"/> (required) OR <add key="cm.smsgateway.customer" value="YOUR CUSTOMER ID"/> (required) <add key="cm.smsgateway.username" value="YOUR USERNAME"/> (required) <add key="cm.smsgateway.password" value="YOUR PASSWORD"/> (required) <appSettings>
